00013 #include "common.hpp"
00014 #include <boost/numeric/ublas/io.hpp>
00015 
00016 namespace isis
00017 {
00018 
00019 namespace data

00022 namespace _internal

00025 
00026 bool transformCoords( isis::util::PropertyMap &properties, util::vector4<size_t> size, boost::numeric::ublas::matrix<float> transform, bool transformCenterIsImageCenter  )
00027 {
00028     if( !properties.hasProperty( "rowVec" ) || !properties.hasProperty( "columnVec" ) || !properties.hasProperty( "sliceVec" )
00029         || !properties.hasProperty( "voxelSize" ) || !properties.hasProperty( "indexOrigin" ) ) {
00030         LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Missing one of the properties (rowVec, columnVec, sliceVec, voxelSize, indexOrigin)";
00031         return false;
00032     }
00033 
00034     using namespace boost::numeric::ublas;
00035     // this implementation assumes that the PropMap properties is either a
00036     // data::Chunk or a data::Image object. Hence it should contain the
00037     // properties rowVec, columnVec, sliceVec and indexOrigin.
00038     // get row, column and slice vector from property map
00039     isis::util::fvector4 row = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "rowVec" );
00040     isis::util::fvector4 column = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "columnVec" );
00041     isis::util::fvector4 slice = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "sliceVec" );
00042     // get index origin from property map
00043     isis::util::fvector4 indexorig = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin" );
00044     vector<float> origin_out = vector<float>( 3 );
00045     //check if we have a property "voxelGap" to prevent isis from throwing a warning "blabla"
00046     isis::util::fvector4 scaling;
00047 
00048     if( properties.hasProperty( "voxelGap" ) ) {
00049         scaling  = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelSize" ) +  properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelGap" );
00050     } else {
00051         scaling  = properties.getPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelSize" );
00052     }
00053 
00054     // create boost::numeric data structures
00055     // STEP 1 transform orientation matrix
00056     // input matrix
00057     matrix<float> R_in( 3, 3 );
00058 
00059     for( int i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00060         R_in( i, 0 ) = row[i];
00061         R_in( i, 1 ) = column[i];
00062         R_in( i, 2 ) = slice[i];
00063     }
00064 
00065     matrix<float> R_out( 3, 3 );
00066 
00067     if( transformCenterIsImageCenter ) {
00068         R_out = prod( R_in, transform );
00069     } else {
00070         R_out = prod( transform, R_in );
00071     }
00072 
00073     for ( int i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00074         row[i] = R_out( i, 0 );
00075         column[i] = R_out( i, 1 );
00076         slice[i] = R_out( i, 2 );
00077     }
00078 
00079     vector<float> origin_in( 3 );
00080 
00081     for( int i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00082         origin_in( i ) = indexorig[i];
00083     }
00084 
00085     //the center of the transformation is the image center (eg. spm transformation)
00086     if( transformCenterIsImageCenter ) {
00087         matrix<float> R_in_inverse( R_in );
00088 
00089         if( !_internal::inverseMatrix<float>( R_in, R_in_inverse ) ) {
00090             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Can not inverse orientation matrix: " << R_in;
00091             return false;
00092         }
00093 
00094         //we have to map the indexes of the image size into the scanner space
00095 
00096         vector<float> physicalSize( 3 );
00097         vector<float> boostScaling( 3 );
00098 
00099         for ( unsigned short i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00100             physicalSize( i ) = size[i] * scaling[i];
00101             boostScaling( i ) = scaling[i];
00102         }
00103 
00104         // now we have to calculate the center of the image in physical space
00105         vector<float> half_image( 3 );
00106 
00107         for ( unsigned short i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00108             half_image( i ) = ( physicalSize( i )  - boostScaling( i ) ) * 0.5;
00109         }
00110 
00111         vector<float> center_image = prod( R_in, half_image ) + origin_in ;
00112         //now translate this center to the center of the physical space and get the new image origin
00113         vector<float> io_translated = origin_in - center_image;
00114         //now multiply this translated origin with the inverse of the orientation matrix of the image
00115         vector<float> io_ortho = prod( R_in_inverse, io_translated );
00116         //now transform this matrix with the actual transformation matrix
00117         vector<float> transformed_io_ortho = prod( io_ortho, transform );
00118         //now transform ths point back with the orientation matrix of the image
00119         vector<float> transformed_io = prod( R_in, transformed_io_ortho );
00120         //and finally we have to retranslate this origin to get the image to our old position in physical space
00121         origin_out = transformed_io + center_image;
00122 
00123     } else {
00124         origin_out = prod( transform, origin_in );
00125     }
00126 
00127     for( int i = 0; i < 3; i++ ) {
00128         indexorig[i] = origin_out( i );
00129     }
00130 
00131     // write modified values back into property map
00132     properties.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin", indexorig );
00133     properties.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "rowVec", row );
00134     properties.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "columnVec", column );
00135     properties.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "sliceVec", slice );
00136     return true;
00137 }
00138 
00139 }
00140 }
00141 }
